text: Common Equity Tier 1 (CET1) capital consists primarily of ordinary shares, retained earnings, accumulated other comprehensive income, and other disclosed reserves, after applying regulatory deductions.
Additional Tier 1 (AT1) capital includes instruments that are subordinated, perpetual in nature, and able to absorb losses on a going concern basis.
Tier 2 capital consists of subordinated instruments with a minimum original maturity of at least five years and limited ability to absorb losses.
Total capital is the sum of Common Equity Tier 1 capital, Additional Tier 1 capital, and Tier 2 capital.
Institutions must ensure that Total Capital equals the sum of CET1, AT1, and Tier 2 capital amounts reported in the COREP templates.
